bill_title: increase the number of judges in the Second and Seventh Judicial Circuits.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to approve the addition of judges to the Second and Seventh Judicial Circuits and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two hundred twenty-seven thousand two hundred sixteen dollars ($227,216), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Unified Judicial System for the creation of a circuit court judgeship in the Second Judicial Circuit. The sum of two hundred thirteen thousand five hundred seventy-one dollars ($213,571) appropriated by this section may be used for personal services and benefits. The sum of thirteen thousand six hundred forty-five dollars ($13,645) may be used for operational expenses. Section 2. There is hereby approved 2.0 FTE for a circuit judge position and support staff in the Second Judicial Circuit. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of two hundred twenty-seven thousand two hundred sixteen dollars ($227,216), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Unified Judicial System for the creation of a circuit court judgeship in the Seventh Judicial circuit. The sum of two hundred thirteen thousand five hundred seventy-one dollars ($213,571) appropriated by this section may be used for personal services and benefits. The sum of thirteen thousand six hundred forty-five dollars ($13,645) may be used for operational expenses. Section 4. There is hereby approved 2.0 FTE for a circuit court judge position and support staff in the Seventh Judicial Circuit. Section 5. The state court administrator shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 6. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2016, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to approve the addition of judges to the Second and Seventh Judicial Circuits and to make an appropriation therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one dollar ($1), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Unified Judicial System for the creation of a circuit court judgeship in the Second Judicial Circuit. The sum of one dollar ($1) appropriated by this section may be used for personal services and benefits. The sum of one dollar ($1) may be used for operational expenses. Section 2. There is hereby approved 2.0 FTE for a circuit judge position and support staff in the Second Judicial Circuit. Section 3. There is hereby appropriated from the general fund the sum of one dollar ($1), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Unified Judicial System for the creation of a circuit court judgeship in the Seventh Judicial circuit. The sum of one dollar ($1) appropriated by this section may be used for personal services and benefits. The sum of one dollar ($1) may be used for operational expenses. Section 4. There is hereby approved 2.0 FTE for a circuit court judge position and support staff in the Seventh Judicial Circuit. Section 5. The state court administrator shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 6. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2016, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

The sum of two dollars ($2) appropriated by this section may be used for personal services and benefits. The sum of two dollars ($2) may be used for operational expenses. Section 4. There is hereby approved 2.0 FTE for a circuit court judge position and support staff in the Seventh Judicial Circuit. Section 5. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2016, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase the number of judges in the Second and Seventh Judicial Circuits. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 16-6-1 be amended to read as follows: 16-6-1. The number of circuit judges of each of the judicial circuits established by § 16-5-1.2 is as follows: (1) First Circuit: Six circuit judges; (2) Second Circuit: Ten Eleven circuit judges; (3) Third Circuit: Six circuit judges; (4) Fourth Circuit: Four circuit judges; (5) Fifth Circuit: Four circuit judges; (6) Sixth Circuit: Four circuit judges; (7) Seventh Circuit: Seven Eight circuit judges. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
